trans-unit.source: Login Pages and Home Realm Discovery
trans-unit.target: Login Pages and Home Realm Discovery

trans-unit.source: Azure
trans-unit.target: Azure

trans-unit.source: Login Pages and Home Realm Discovery
trans-unit.target: Login Pages and Home Realm Discovery

trans-unit.source: <token>firstref_acs</token> provides two easy ways to generate a federated login page for your website or application:
trans-unit.target: <token>firstref_acs</token> provides two easy ways to generate a federated login page for your website or application:

trans-unit.source: Option 1: ACS-Hosted Login Page
trans-unit.target: Option 1: ACS-Hosted Login Page

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> hosts a basic federated login page that can be used in your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> hosts a basic federated login page that can be used in your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: This login page is hosted at the WS-Federation protocol endpoint for your namespace and can be accessed by a URL with the following format.
trans-unit.target: This login page is hosted at the WS-Federation protocol endpoint for your namespace and can be accessed by a URL with the following format.

trans-unit.source: In this URL, replace <userInput><YourNamespace></userInput> with the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: In this URL, replace <userInput><YourNamespace></userInput> with the name of your <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: In addition, this URL requires the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: In addition, this URL requires the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>wa</embeddedLabel>—Set to <userInput>wsignin1.0</userInput>
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>wa</embeddedLabel>—Set to <userInput>wsignin1.0</userInput>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>wtrealm</embeddedLabel>—Set to the value of the realm for your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>wtrealm</embeddedLabel>—Set to the value of the realm for your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: To find the realm value, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, select an application, and see the <ui>Realm</ui> field.
trans-unit.target: To find the realm value, in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal, click <ui>Relying party applications</ui>, select an application, and see the <ui>Realm</ui> field.

trans-unit.source: To find the login page links for your relying party applications:
trans-unit.target: To find the login page links for your relying party applications:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Application integration</ui>, click <ui>Login pages</ui>, and then select a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Application integration</ui>, click <ui>Login pages</ui>, and then select a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page displays login page options for the application.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page displays login page options for the application.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows the default login page for an application that supports <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Yahoo!, Facebook, and "Contoso Corp," a fictitious WS-Federation identity provider.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows the default login page for an application that supports <token>ms_acct</token>, Google, Yahoo!, Facebook, and "Contoso Corp," a fictitious WS-Federation identity provider.

trans-unit.source: To replace a WS-Federation identify provider button with an e-mail address text box, add e-mail address suffixes to the login page links for your WS-Federation identity provider.
trans-unit.target: To replace a WS-Federation identify provider button with an e-mail address text box, add e-mail address suffixes to the login page links for your WS-Federation identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This approach is useful when a many WS-Federation identity providers are configured for your relying party application.
trans-unit.target: This approach is useful when a many WS-Federation identity providers are configured for your relying party application.

trans-unit.source: The following image shows a sample page.
trans-unit.target: The following image shows a sample page.

trans-unit.source: To expedite the integration of <token>secondref_acs</token> with your relying party application, use the default <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login page.
trans-unit.target: To expedite the integration of <token>secondref_acs</token> with your relying party application, use the default <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login page.

trans-unit.source: To customize the layout and appearance of this page, save the default login page as an HTML file and copy the HTML and JavaScript to your application where it can be customized.
trans-unit.target: To customize the layout and appearance of this page, save the default login page as an HTML file and copy the HTML and JavaScript to your application where it can be customized.

trans-unit.source: Option 2: Host a Custom Login Page as Part of Your Application
trans-unit.target: Option 2: Host a Custom Login Page as Part of Your Application

trans-unit.source: To enable full control over the appearance, behavior, and location of your federated login page, <token>secondref_acs</token> provides a JSON-encoded metadata feed with the names, login URLs, images, and e-mail domain names (<token>secondref_adfs2</token> only) of your identity providers.
trans-unit.target: To enable full control over the appearance, behavior, and location of your federated login page, <token>secondref_acs</token> provides a JSON-encoded metadata feed with the names, login URLs, images, and e-mail domain names (<token>secondref_adfs2</token> only) of your identity providers.

trans-unit.source: This feed is known as the Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed.
trans-unit.target: This feed is known as the Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed.

trans-unit.source: Sample custom login page
trans-unit.target: Sample custom login page

trans-unit.source: To download an sample HTML login page for each of your relying party applications:
trans-unit.target: To download an sample HTML login page for each of your relying party applications:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Application integration</ui>, click <ui>Login pages</ui> and then select a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Application integration</ui>, click <ui>Login pages</ui> and then select a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page, click <ui>Download Example Login Page</ui>.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page, click <ui>Download Example Login Page</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The sample HTML code is identical to the HTML code for the <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login page.
trans-unit.target: The sample HTML code is identical to the HTML code for the <token>secondref_acs</token>-hosted login page.

trans-unit.source: This sample includes JavaScript functions for rendering the page.
trans-unit.target: This sample includes JavaScript functions for rendering the page.

trans-unit.source: A script tag at the bottom of the page calls the metadata feed.
trans-unit.target: A script tag at the bottom of the page calls the metadata feed.

trans-unit.source: Custom login pages can consume the metadata using pure client-side HTML and JavaScript as shown in this example.
trans-unit.target: Custom login pages can consume the metadata using pure client-side HTML and JavaScript as shown in this example.

trans-unit.source: The feed can also be consumed and used to render a custom login control in any language that supports JSON encoding.
trans-unit.target: The feed can also be consumed and used to render a custom login control in any language that supports JSON encoding.

trans-unit.source: Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed
trans-unit.target: Home Realm Discovery Metadata Feed

trans-unit.source: To find the home realm discovery metadata feed URLs for your relying party applications:
trans-unit.target: To find the home realm discovery metadata feed URLs for your relying party applications:

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Application integration</ui>, click <ui>Login pages</ui>, and then select a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Application integration</ui>, click <ui>Login pages</ui>, and then select a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: The URL appears on the <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page for the application under <ui>Option 2: Host the login page as part of your application</ui>.
trans-unit.target: The URL appears on the <ui>Login Page Integration</ui> page for the application under <ui>Option 2: Host the login page as part of your application</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The following is a sample home realm discovery feed URL.
trans-unit.target: The following is a sample home realm discovery feed URL.

trans-unit.source: This URL uses the following parameters:
trans-unit.target: This URL uses the following parameters:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>YourNamespace</embeddedLabel>—Required.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>YourNamespace</embeddedLabel>—Required.

trans-unit.source: Set to the name of your Azure namespace.
trans-unit.target: Set to the name of your Azure namespace.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>protocol</embeddedLabel>—Required.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>protocol</embeddedLabel>—Required.

trans-unit.source: This is the protocol that your relying party application uses to communicate with <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the protocol that your relying party application uses to communicate with <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: In <token>secondref_acs</token> this value must be set to <userInput>wsfederation</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In <token>secondref_acs</token> this value must be set to <userInput>wsfederation</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>realm</embeddedLabel>—Required.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>realm</embeddedLabel>—Required.

trans-unit.source: This is the realm that you specified for your relying party application in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This is the realm that you specified for your relying party application in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>version</embeddedLabel>—Required.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>version</embeddedLabel>—Required.

trans-unit.source: In <token>secondref_acs</token> this value must be set to 1.0.
trans-unit.target: In <token>secondref_acs</token> this value must be set to 1.0.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>reply_to</embeddedLabel>—Optional.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>reply_to</embeddedLabel>—Optional.

trans-unit.source: This is the return URL that you specified for your relying party application in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This is the return URL that you specified for your relying party application in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: If omitted, the value of the return URL is set to the default value that is configured for your relying party application in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: If omitted, the value of the return URL is set to the default value that is configured for your relying party application in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>context</embeddedLabel>—Optional.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>context</embeddedLabel>—Optional.

trans-unit.source: This is any additional context that can be passed back to the relying party application in the token.
trans-unit.target: This is any additional context that can be passed back to the relying party application in the token.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> does not recognize these contents.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> does not recognize these contents.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>callback</embeddedLabel>—Optional.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>callback</embeddedLabel>—Optional.

trans-unit.source: You can set this parameter to the name of a JavaScript function that you want to run when the JSON feed is loaded.
trans-unit.target: You can set this parameter to the name of a JavaScript function that you want to run when the JSON feed is loaded.

trans-unit.source: The JSON feed string is the argument that is passed to this function.
trans-unit.target: The JSON feed string is the argument that is passed to this function.

trans-unit.source: The JSON-encoded metadata feed may be subject to change therefore it is recommended that you do not cache it.
trans-unit.target: The JSON-encoded metadata feed may be subject to change therefore it is recommended that you do not cache it.

trans-unit.source: JSON feed data format
trans-unit.target: JSON feed data format

trans-unit.source: When the metadata feed is requested with valid parameters as previously described, the response is a document containing a JSON-encoded array of arrays, with each internal array representing an identity provider with the following fields:
trans-unit.target: When the metadata feed is requested with valid parameters as previously described, the response is a document containing a JSON-encoded array of arrays, with each internal array representing an identity provider with the following fields:

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Name</embeddedLabel>—The human-readable display name for the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Name</embeddedLabel>—The human-readable display name for the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>LoginUrl</embeddedLabel>—A constructed login request URL.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>LoginUrl</embeddedLabel>—A constructed login request URL.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>LogoutUrl</embeddedLabel>—This URL allows end users to sign out of the identity provider they signed in with.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>LogoutUrl</embeddedLabel>—This URL allows end users to sign out of the identity provider they signed in with.

trans-unit.source: This is currently only supported for <token>secondref_adfs2</token> and <token>ms_acct</token> and is empty for other identity providers.
trans-unit.target: This is currently only supported for <token>secondref_adfs2</token> and <token>ms_acct</token> and is empty for other identity providers.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>ImageUrl</embeddedLabel>—The image to display, as configured in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>ImageUrl</embeddedLabel>—The image to display, as configured in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Blank if there is no image.
trans-unit.target: Blank if there is no image.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>EmailAddressSuffixes</embeddedLabel>—An array of email address suffixes associated with the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>EmailAddressSuffixes</embeddedLabel>—An array of email address suffixes associated with the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: In <token>secondref_acs</token>, email address suffixes can only be configured for <token>secondref_adfs2</token> identity providers via the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: In <token>secondref_acs</token>, email address suffixes can only be configured for <token>secondref_adfs2</token> identity providers via the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Returns an empty array if there are no suffixes configured.
trans-unit.target: Returns an empty array if there are no suffixes configured.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows the JSON feed when <token>windows_live_id</token> and AD FS 2.0 are configured for the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows the JSON feed when <token>windows_live_id</token> and AD FS 2.0 are configured for the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: The user has set an image URL for <token>windows_live_id</token> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and added an e-mail domain suffix for the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> identity provider.
trans-unit.target: The user has set an image URL for <token>windows_live_id</token> in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal and added an e-mail domain suffix for the <token>secondref_adfs2</token> identity provider.

trans-unit.source: We have added line breaks for readability and the URLs have been simplified for brevity.
trans-unit.target: We have added line breaks for readability and the URLs have been simplified for brevity.
